quarters.insights: In Q1 2023, MSFT demonstrated strong profitability with a net income of $18.3 billion, reflecting a robust operating margin of 42.2%. The return on equity (ROE) stood at 33.3%, indicating effective utilization of shareholders' equity. The revenue growth trajectory is promising, with gross profit margins remaining healthy.

Q2 2023 saw an increase in net income to $20.1 billion, with an operating margin of 43.2%. This indicates improved operational efficiency and cost management. The consistent ROE of 33.3% reflects MSFT's ability to generate returns on equity effectively, maintaining investor confidence.

In Q3 2023, MSFT achieved a net income of $22.3 billion, with an impressive operating margin of 47.6%. This quarter marked a significant improvement in profitability, showcasing the company's strong market position and operational effectiveness. The stable ROE further emphasizes the company's commitment to delivering shareholder value.

Q4 2023 concluded with a net income of $21.9 billion and an operating margin of 43.6%. The slight decrease in net income compared to Q3 reflects seasonal variations, yet the overall profitability remains strong. The consistent ROE indicates that MSFT continues to effectively leverage its equity to generate profits.

In Q1 2024, MSFT reported a net income of $24.1 billion, with an operating margin of 45.6%. This reflects a strong start to the fiscal year, with revenue growth indicating robust demand for its products and services. The consistent ROE reinforces the company's ability to generate substantial returns for its shareholders.

Q2 2024 saw a net income of $22.0 billion, with an operating margin of 43.1%. The slight decrease in net income compared to Q1 reflects typical seasonal trends, yet profitability remains strong. The stable ROE indicates that MSFT continues to effectively utilize its equity to generate profits.

In Q3 2024, MSFT achieved a net income of $24.7 billion, with an operating margin of 46.5%. This quarter reflects strong operational performance and effective cost management, contributing to enhanced profitability. The consistent ROE underscores the company's commitment to delivering shareholder value.

Q4 2024 concluded with a net income of $24.1 billion and an operating margin of 34.6%. The decrease in operating margin compared to Q3 reflects seasonal variations, yet the overall profitability remains strong. The consistent ROE indicates that MSFT continues to effectively leverage its equity to generate profits.
